sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_2:
To find the determinant of a 2x2 matrix, use the formula:

Determinant = (a * d) - (b * c)

where a, b, c, and d are the elements of the matrix:

\begin{bmatrix} 
a & b \\
c & d \\ 
\end{bmatrix}

In this case, the matrix is:

\begin{bmatrix} 
2 & 3 \\
4 & -1 \\ 
\end{bmatrix}

So, a = 2, b = 3, c = 4, and d = -1.

Now, apply the formula:

Determinant = (2 * -1) - (3 * 4) = -2 - 12 = -14

The determinant of the given matrix is -14.
